First Meeting 28 December 2025 6 min read

Preparing for Your First Behaviour Support Meeting

First MeetingPreparationWhat to Expect

Before the Meeting

A productive first meeting sets the tone for a successful partnership. As a Registered Practitioner, my goal is to ensure this process is transparent, respectful, and evidence-based from day one.

Gather Relevant Information

Having these documents ready helps us hit the ground running:

  • Current NDIS plan and specific goals
  • Past Behaviour Support Plans (BSPs) or assessments
  • Incident reports or "ABC" data logs from the last 3 months
  • Relevant medical, OT, or Speech Pathology reports

Who Should Attend?

Behaviour support is most effective when it is collaborative. We often refer to this as the "Circle of Support."

While the Participant should be at the heart of the meeting, it is often helpful to have a primary family member and a representative from the daily support team present to provide diverse perspectives.

Questions for Me

I encourage you to interview me as much as I interview you. You might ask:

  • What is your experience with similar support needs?
  • How do you involve the participant in the decision-making process?
  • How do you approach the reduction of restrictive practices?
  • What does your communication look like with our existing team?

Clinical Lead

Providing evidence-based Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) across Australia. My focus is on human rights, data-driven assessment, and empowering the participant's support network.
